content: This PR has been for four months and a half now. @Antoine Chambert-Loir reviewed (thanks :pray:) but nothing since. I know not many people are interested in combinatorics, but still it would be nice to tick this one off.
This PR is still around after five months and a half. Any takers?
Except for the abbreviation mono — for “monochromatic”, which is used with too many meanings in mathlib (also for “monotone”, for example), I have nothing to add.

(There are stylistic remarks that are not really worth being made, such as for left alignment of subsequent lines in docstrings — should they be indented by 2 spaces? — or the space between lines. I know what I prefer, some reviewers made me make something, but some others do differently, so I don't feel I have to insist on that.)

Antoine Chambert-Loir said:

Except for the abbreviation mono — for “monochromatic”, which is used with too many meanings in mathlib (also for “monotone”, for example), I have nothing to add.

docs#Combinatorics.Line.IsMono already exists, so renaming is out of scope for this PR.

Without having any opinion here myself, I think a reviewer should reasonably be able to reply here: well, you better rename IsMono in separate PR first, in that case.

(Or at least promise to do is soon in a follow-up.)
I don't want to insist, this is a massively collaborative work and options should not solely rely on 1-1 interactions in a PR review.
monoχ\text{mono}\chimonoχ is how I typically see it written on blackboards if the goal is to save space, since χ\chiχ is the standard letter for colourings and the chromatic number

Kim Morrison said:

think a reviewer should reasonably be able to reply here: well, you better rename IsMono in separate PR first, in that case.

I disagree. Given that I am not introducing any new naming convention, the matter of renaming should be dealt with completely separately, if at all.

Personally, I'm just trying to get a PR from January 2022 (!!) in and I have nothing to do with how the names were chosen. I won't name the new definition Subspace.IsMonochromatic so long as the existing definition is called Line.IsMono, and I also think that abbreviating "monochromatic" to "mono" here is perfectly acceptable since we're in a namespace (Combinatorics.Line/Combinatorics.Subspace) where no other interpretation of "mono" makes sense.

Kim, let me rephrase your rebuttal in terms that are more familiar to you, and I will let you make up your mind on whether it is ridiculous or not:

  • Why are you introducing derivedCategory? A category is just a monoidoid. Please call your new definition derivedMonoidoid.
  • Well, existing definitions in mathlib use the name "category".
  • You better rename Category to Monoidoid in a separate PR first, in that case (or at least promise to do it soon in a follow-up)."
Sorry I feel like I am coming off as a bit dismissive here. The sentiment is that I just want to get on with my life and not worry about stupid naming issues which are not even my battle.
:ping_pong: 7 months and counting
I've kicked the two deps on the queue
